rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Begonia
rdf:Description.ns4:abstract: Begonia is a genus of perennial flowering plants in the family Begoniaceae. The genus contains more than 2,000 different plant species. The Begonias are native to moist subtropical and tropical climates. Some species are commonly grown indoors as ornamental houseplants in cooler climates. In cooler climates some species are cultivated outside in summertime for their bright colorful flowers, which have sepals but no petals.
rdf:Description.ns1:taxonomy: The genus name Begonia was coined by Charles Plumier , a French patron of botany , and adopted by Linnaeus in 1753, to honor Michel Bégon , a former governor of the French colony of Saint-Domingue (now Haiti ). Begonia Charles Plumier botany Linnaeus Michel Bégon Saint-Domingue Haiti
